        int main() {

            // Step 2: compute X from second_line
            char *a = second_line;
            // Strip leading and trailing '0' and ' '
            char *start = a;
            char *end = a + strlen(a) - 1;
            while (start <= end && (*start=='0' || *start==' ')) start++;
            while (end >= start && (*end=='0' || *end==' ')) end--;
            long long X = 0;
            int len_stripped = (end - start + 1);
            if (len_stripped <= 0) {
                X = 0;
            } else {
                // Count the number of '1' in the stripped part
                int count_ones = 0;
                for (char *p = start; p <= end; p++) {
                    if (*p=='1') count_ones++;
                }
                if (count_ones == 0) {
                    X = 0;
                } else {
                    // We'll split by '1' and compute the product.
                    X = 1;
                    // We traverse the stripped string and split by '1'
                    char *seg_start = start;
                    for (char *p = start; p <= end; p++) {
                        if (*p == '1') {

                            int cnt = 0;

                    }
                    X *= (cnt + 1);
                }
            }

            // Step 3: compute Y from X
            long long N = X;
            long long power = 10;
            long long Y = 0;
            while (power <= N) {
                Y += (power - power/10);
                power *= 100;
            }
            long long base = power / 10;
            if (N >= base) {
                Y += (N - base + 1);
            }

                    if (num_g > num_p) {
                        num_p++;
                    } else {
                        score--;
                        num_g++;
                    }
                }
            }
